_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CORN PLUS IS STRONGLY COMMITTED TO THE HEALTH AND WELL BEING OF ITS EMPLOYEES, OUTSIDE CONTRACTORS, VISITORS ETC... AS WELL AS THE LOCAL COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION CORN PLUS BELIEVES IN PRESERVING OUR ENVIRONMENT FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. THIS COMMITTMENT IS AN INHERENT PART OF OUR PLANT DAILY OPERATION. PERSONNEL SAFETY, AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES WILL NOT BE SACRIFICED IN ORDER TO ENHANCE PLANT PROFITABILITY.



CORN PLUS' APPROACH IS TO BE PRO-ACTIVE RATHER THAN REACTIVE THROUGH EMPLOYEE, CONTRACTOR, AND OTHER OUTSIDE CONTRACTING PERSONNEL DOCUMENTED TRAINING.



OUR FACILITY'S PRIMARY ACTIVITY IS ETHANOL PRODUCTION FROM CORN. AQUEOUS AMMONIA IS USED IN THE PRODUCTION PROCESS PRIMARILY FOR PH CONTROL.  ETHANOL IS DENATURED WITH NATURAL GASOLINE AND STORED ON SITE UNTIL SHIPPED.



WE UTIIZED EPA'S OCA PROGRAM RMPCOMP FOR THE WORST CASE AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS OF THE REQUIRED OFF SITE CONSEQUENCES AND PROVIDED ADDITIONAL ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS FOR BETTER EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLANNING EFFORTS.



THE RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM CONSISTS OF BUT IS NOT LIMITED TOO:



1.   MAINTAINING A DETAILED RECORD OF SAFETY INFORMATION THAT  DESCRIBES THE CHEMICAL HAZARDS, OPERATING PARAMETERS AND EQUIPMENT DESIGNS ASSOCIATED WITH ALL PROCESSES.



2.   PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS HAS BEEN CONDUCTED FOR THE AFFECTED PROCESS WITH THE HAZARDS IDENTIFIED AND CONTROLLED. ANY FINDINGS FROM THE HAZARD ANALYSIS ARE ADDRESSED IN A TIMELY MANNER.



3.   OPERATING PROCEDURES ARE ON THE PLANT SITE AND REVIEWED WITH EMPLOYEES REGULARLY, NEW EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN PROCEUDRES THROUGH ORAL COMMUNICATION, CLASSROOM AND ON THE JOB TRAINING. COMPETENCY IS DEMONSTRATED THROUGH ORAL AND WRITTEN TESTS.



4.   EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN PROCEDURES AND ENCOURAGED TO SEEK OUT HELP IF THEY HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, IF UNSURE DON'T PERFORM THE JOB FUNCTION.



5.   WRITTEN PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE, CONTINUED TRAINING OF EMPLOYEES IS ONGOING TO ENSURE THAT  EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENT IN THE OPERATING PROCESSES.

6.   CORN PLUS CONDUCTS DOCUMENTED MAINTENANCE CHECKS OF PROCESS EQUIPMENT TO ENSURE PROPER OPERATION. MAINTENANCE CHECKS ARE PERFORMED BY QUALIFIED PERSONNEL WITH PREVIOUS TRAINING IN MAINTENANCE PRACTICES. EXAMPLES OF EQUIPMENT THAT WOULD RECEIVE MAINTENANCE CHECKS INCLUDE: PIPES, PUMPS, TANKS, RELIEFS VALVES, CONTROLS ETC.



7.   CORN PLUS CONDUCTS PRE-STARTUP TRAINING FOR EMPLOYEES WHEN A NEW PROCESS IS ADDED OR MODIFICATIONS HAVE BEEN MADE TO EXISTING AFFECTED PROCESSES.



8.   CORN PLUS WILL CONDUCT COMPLIANCE AUDITS OF PROCEDURES WITH EMPLOYEES OF AFFECTED PROCESSES ON A REGULAR BASIS.



9.   CORN PLUS BELIEVES THAT PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT AND ACCIDENT / INCIDENT PREVENTION IS A TEAM EFFORT. CORN PLUS' BELIEF IS TO BE PRO-ACTIVE NOT REACTIVE.



10. CORN PLUS IS COMMITTED TO SAFETY OF ALL EMPLOYEES AND CONTRACTORS.



11. CORN PLUS MAINTAINS A WRITTEN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN ON SITE TO DEAL WITH ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS. THE PLAN ADDRESSES ALL ASPECTS OF EMERGENCY RESPONSE INCLUDING FIRST AID, EVACUATION, AND PROPER NOTIFICATION OF LOCAL AND STATE AGENCIES.
